Osteospermum Soprano White

Osteospermum also commonly known as "African Daisy" have origins from South Africa. This variety grows as shrubs or mounds, and is a perinnial plant often found in warm weather environments. These plants have oval green or gray green leaves. The flowers display strikingly clear white petals with sapphire blue eyes. The shrubs are do not grow too tall and have a spread of 12-14 inches and height of around 8-14 inches. They attract wild life like bees and butterflies and are commonly found in California.
